statement: Humacyte, Inc. is being sued for alleged securities fraud, with investors having an opportunity to lead the class action lawsuit. The complaint alleges that the company failed to disclose its Durham, North Carolina facility's non-compliance with good manufacturing practices and microbial testing, leading to delays in the FDA's review of its Biologics License Application. The lawsuit claims that Humacyte made false statements and concealed this information from investors between May 10, 2024 and October 17, 2024, resulting in losses for shareholders. Several law firms, including Levi & Korsinsky, Schall Law Firm, and Rosen Law Firm, are involved in the case, and investors have until January 17, 2025 to seek appointment as lead plaintiff.
